subject: Ethics
title: The Four Principles of Bioethics
description: A 60-second lesson on The Four Principles of Bioethics.

hook.text: A doctor has a cure but the patient refuses it. Should the doctor force treatment?

buildup.text: Beauchamp and Childress proposed four principles to navigate medical ethics dilemmas.

discovery.text: Autonomy, beneficence, non-maleficence, and justiceâ€”four pillars holding up bioethics.

twist.text: The principles often clash. Respecting a patient's choice may mean letting them suffer.

climax.text: No single principle always wins. Bioethics lives in the tension between all four.

punchline.text: Four simple words. A lifetime of hard choices.

quiz.question: Which four principles form the foundation of modern bioethics?
